title: ETZ-Swap × OrangeFren: Confidential, Transparent Route Discovery for Non-Custodial Swaps
keyQuestions: What is OrangeFren and how does it help users discover safer routes?
How does this partnership improve route transparency without custodial risk?
Which privacy filters and badges matter most for XMR-oriented flows?
What does OrangeFren’s directory guarantee cover, and when does it apply?
How should users choose a route and execute it non-custodially with ETZ-Swap?
quickSteps: Open OrangeFren and apply privacy filters (Never-KYC, Tor-ready, established listings).
Compare routes by effective cost, expected time windows, and execution notes.
Pick a route and proceed to execute the swap non-custodially with ETZ-Swap.
Keep swap details and timing consistent with the chosen route assumptions.
If a guarantee-backed listing applies and an edge-case occurs, follow the guarantee process.

issueRouting.start: I want a private way to compare routes before I swap, without giving up control of funds

branches.if: I need maximum privacy while researching routes
then: Use OrangeFren’s no-tracking approach and prefer mirror/Tor access when available
Filter for Never-KYC and Tor-ready badges to reduce data exposure
Only execute once you understand expected fees and timing

branches.if: I care most about reliability and fewer failed attempts
then: Prioritize established listings and clear execution notes
Choose routes with transparent time windows and realistic confirmation expectations
Execute non-custodially with ETZ-Swap and monitor status updates

branches.if: I want additional recourse for edge cases
then: Prefer guarantee-backed directory listings where applicable
Document the route choice and keep transaction details consistent
Follow the guarantee process if a listed venue fails to deliver under the program’s terms

riskNotes: Directory discovery and swap execution are separate: confirm what OrangeFren provides vs what ETZ-Swap executes.
Filters reduce risk, but they don’t eliminate it—verify assumptions like fees, timing, and network conditions.
Guarantee programs apply only to selected listings and specific cases; read the terms before relying on it.
Avoid sharing unnecessary personal data when researching routes; keep operational hygiene simple and consistent.
